reviewText: Small on the bottom, large on the top.

The bra top looks good on the model, but it looked awful on me. I thought the top had cups in it, which it did not (the model HAS to be wearing some kind of supportive cup for her figure to look like that; no one is shaped like that or that smooth without support). I am a C, so I need support. The top made me look saggy, not sexy, and I thought I was going to poke right through it, so to speak. I emailed the seller to ask for suggestions on how to improve the top and got an automatic reply from Amazon saying to allow 2 days for a response. I never got a response from the seller. I have taken the top and cups I bought to an alterations person, and I am hoping she will be able to fix it to my satisfaction.

The skirt is definitely big, but it is very adjustable, so no problems there. The shorts are a nice addition so you can decide how exposed you want to be. In general, it's a pretty costume if it fits you right. If you're smaller than a C cup, you might be fine with it as it is, but if you're any bigger, I'd say steer clear unless you plan to purchase some kind of adhesive or sew-in cups. It's reasonably priced, but I think it's important to know that you're not getting any kind of support or shape from the top so you can decide if you want to either invest the extra time and effort to add some, or pay a little more for a costume that already has what you need in that area.
summary: The bra top looks good on the model

reviewText: Very cute, but sizing is all off.  Bikini top is alright but runs small.  The skirt is HUGE and LONG!  I don't know how this would for the average person.  If you have the time, I recommend purchasing this, but fixing it it with sewing or safety pins to fit you.
summary: Fine quality, but sizing all off

Top meant more for A-B cup I'm a C but back clip seriously would need to be reinforced for anyone. Surprised I had to alter skirt I'm a size 8-10 and skirt was still too big for even me.

Having said all this for price it's a great item, just get before time you need it fe alterations.

reviewText:
This space slave costume is beautifully designed and manufactured, all of the stitching it good and strong, and the materials used are super soft it feels very nice against your skin, the costume is made up with a mixture of polyester and spandex which gives it this super softness.

The costume comes to you in four parts, you get the main skirt and then a bra and some panty, then you have a neck collar and wrist cuff with a chain between them.

The skirt at the top has a minimum width of 45cm (90cm Diameter), and then it has a maximum width of 68cm (136cm Diameter), so its going to fit most size females, the skirt has a length of 104cm, and the skirt has a bottom width of 58cm on both the front and back panels, the four hip straps at the top have a relaxed length of 13cm each, and the top front and back gold middle panels are elastic, and have a relaxed size of 20cm in their width, and  8cm minimum in their length, there is no ruff edging to the skirt so you won't get any chaffing when you wear the cosplay costume.

The Bra is all nice and soft too, and is not see though, and the shortest length you can have the two straps are as follows 10cm, but at their maximum length they are 21cm, it has a nice fastening clasp on the back, they just slip together and lock together.

The Panty are also well made and have no ruff edging, and are made from 95% polyester and 5% spandex, which give them a nice soft feel to them, and also some nice stretch, the smallest the width can be is 31cm (62cm Diameter), and the maximum width they can be is 50cm (100cm Diameter, they have good stretch around the waist line and also around both leg holes.

Lastly there is the Neck cuff and wrist cuff, with its 82cm in length connecting chain , which is made from a light ally metal, the neck cuff will feel comfortable on a maximum neck diameter of 40cm, and a minimum neck size of 17cm, the neck cuff has a Velcro fastener so you can place it around your neck with ease, and the wrist cuff has plenty of spandex in it so you can slip your hand through it with ease too.

I ordered a whole bunch of them and as soon as they arrive, I will start putting them up. These signs are super lightweight so I'm glad I can put them up using nails instead of messing with screws and anchors.

reviewText:
I love these! I somehow managed to lose my first set that I bought even though they were full of stuff. I looked for them for a few months and ended up buying anotherset because these are just so darn handy. I ended up finding my old set and I use all four of the bags. They are small but fit a TON of stuff. I use one in my kids diaper bag, one in my purse, one is in the car being used as a mini emergency kit and the last one I keep in a desk drawer with some little notepads, crayons, a few small kid toys, baby toys, etc so that when we need to go to a doctor appointment or long car ride, I can keep the kids entertained.

These can be used for so many different things and can be very versatile if you want them to be. I am actually planning to go another set so that my preschooler and kindergartner can have a little pack of emergency supplies in their backpacks just in case there is an earthquake, flash flood or any other type of emergency that occurs when they are away from home. Don't be turned off by the size of them because they fit a lot of stuff. I am big into organization and have tried a lot of bags, inserts and other similar items and I always end up coming back to these!

reviewText:
This tie was presented to me as a joke gift and I used it during one of the holiday parties I attended. The graphics printed on it are great, but the highlight is supposed to be the little electronic doo-hickey that, when pressed, lights up two LEDs and provide very tinny segments of holidays tunes. This worked fine when I wore the tie initially and tested it. But, during the very first party I went to, the LEDs only worked the first time. By the second time the button was pressed (i.e. the THIRD time this was used), the LEDs did not light up and the music? There were a few squeaks, but that's all.

How disappointing.

I'll use the tie since I do like the graphics. But I will probably remove the electronics and hope that the LED holes are not too large and can be covered up somehow. Too bad.
summary: Too short of a lifetime for the electronics, but the tie graphics are nice.

I purchased this 7 gem Chakra necklace from kisspat for myself as a daily wearer.  I LOVE The colors of this necklace!  I ordered the amethyst color.  It also came with its own 20" chain.

This necklace is positively stunning, and pictures (although provided for your viewing pleasure) simply can't show the breathtaking beauty.  I have gotten compliments on it every single day!

The gems on this necklace are aligned the same as your chakra is supposed to be in relation to placement on your body.  (From the base of your spine to the crown of your head).  They are very vibrant, and I love having this with me everyday :). I think attention to my chakras definitely makes my energy and spirt much better :)

Each of the chakra gems are bedded into the beautiful amethyst quartz block (amethyst for mine anyhow is the color).  The block is very smooth and polished so well.  It really reflects the light wonderfully.  I have since taken this off the necklace that came with it.  The chain is quite beautiful, but it is too dainty for me since I'm wearing it everyday so I did take a star as I feel this needs a heavier chain.  I have placed it onto a premier jewelry necklace I already had, and it's a wonderful combination.  I did receive this item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

reviewText:
I'm 5'6" and weighed 123 before i got preggo. My bust is currently around 38" while wearing a bra and the medium fit well.

I was initially really disappointed because I put this dress on and it's so low cut that my nipples were about to make an appearance. If you have anything bigger than a modest C cup you'll be showing off a good bit of cleavage in this dress. As is, it was unwearable for me, but on a whim I decided to put it on backwards to see what happened. It was PERFECT. Cute little scoop back and the neckline at the front wasn't weird. There's not a big tag so no stitching in the front to give away that it was on backwards and because the fabric is stretchy the seams fell at just the right place under my arms and on my shoulders.

The fabric is very soft and looks nice without being too causal or too dressy. Wore this to my shower and got lots of compliments.
summary: Whoa cleavage - but there's a work around

reviewText: This dress is gorgeous. It is made of a material that doesn't wrinkle. I ordered the blue one with the blue on top and it looks just like the one on the picture. reviewText: I am happy that I purchased this maxi maternity dress.  I chose the damask print.  I am 5'1" and weigh 160.6 lbs at 30 weeks pregnant.  I wear a 38D and the measurement under my bust/ribcage is 35.5".  I selected the medium and it fits really nicely.  It definitely fits as expected.  This dress fit my bust perfectly and did not scoop too low in the front.  I am able to wear my maternity bra (kindred bravely nursing bra) with no issues.  I get chest pains under my bust if what I'm wearing is too tight under my bust.  This was not too snug and I do feel that I have room to grow without being too restricted.  At 5'1" the length works, but I will most likely hem the length up atleast 1".  I do not see this adjustment as a negative factor because I would rather it be a little longer, so that I can adjust the hem, rather than too short and not be able to make an adjustment to the length because of a lack of fabric.  My 30 week belly is super cute and I cannot wait to wear this out and about.  Love this so much that I just placed an order for another print.  Excited for the new one to arrive!
summary: Fits as expected, comfortable, allows room for adjustment to hem if necessary, great style and material, overall, NICE BUY!!

And of course doing that made the neckline go way down. But that's really my only complaint. A nice dress for a good price.

This material and construction are what you would expect for this price point, but this dress was flattering and comfortable. The belly area has some stretch to it, making it wearable throughout pregnancy and offering some shape, rather than just hanging off the belly. It was a couple inches too long on me, but I am only about 5'2", and it was easy to fix with a little hem tape.

reviewText: First of all, let me just say how hesitant I was to order this dress due to other reviews. It was only after going to 6 stores and not finding one single suitable dress did I finally break down and take the risk. I am 5'6" and 33 weeks pregnant. I was a size "small", 34B and fit size 2 jeans prior to pregnancy, so I buy everything maternity in a small. This dress fit perfectly. I found no issue with the neckline, and I am currently a size 34C. The fabric is thick, not see through and stretching out like most other maternity clothes that I've bought, but also extremely giving. It's not like most maxi dresses for my size that are either so long I'm tripping on them or so short it looks like it shrunk. I would highly recommend this dress.
I loved the dress and the fit. Wore this dress to my shower and it was very comfortable.

Surprisingly great dress. I'm 5'6, 7 months pregnant, roughly a size 8 and I ordered a medium and it fit perfectly. There's still some room to grow but the extra fabric is not unflattering at all. Another reviewer was right, the top is very low cut. Prior to pregnancy I was an A, right now I'm a 36C and my cleavage was everywhere. I flipped the dress around and wore it backwards. Worked great and solved my only complaint. I plan on buying several more.

Length was perfect but the top, black portion was very small -- your chest grows when you are pregnant, so I would have expected more fabric on the top portion - felt like I was popping out of the dress.

reviewText:
At first, I wondered if this was worth it vs. just wiping down my rainboots with a wet cloth.. especially since there are no ingredients listed anywhere on the bottle or online. I took a chance and ordered it anyway, and wiped down my rainboots with it and boy, does it make a difference! Not only did it bring a subtle gloss back to my boots, but I can tell from touching it that there seems to be some kind of wax-like repellent (very subtle) in it, from the way water just beads right off my boots, the way rain beads off of a waxed car. Even though it says to use this on Joules boots, I tried it on my other (non-Joules) rainboots and on a pair of duck skimmers, and same thing.. nice subtle gloss with a waxy overlay. Here are some pics of the before & after shots of my Joules boots as well as my other rain footwear, so you can see for yourself. Pic with the short boots with this bottle is the "After" pic; pic of these boots without the bottle is the "Before" pic.
Tip: The instructions say to spray the product on the boot itself, but I found that it works best when you spray 3-4 times on a soft, absorbant cloth like a microfiber cloth, and wipe the boot down. I'd recommend 3-4 sprays on the cloth PER boot. (2-3 sprays on the cloth PER shoe, if buffing shoes.) When you spray directly onto the boot / shoe, it runs off and does not seem to distribute as well on the entire boot / shoe.

Love this product. revamped a pair of UGG rainboots that I thought were unrepearable Highly recommend this product. I respray my boots every few months and it keeps them looking like new. Wish I had of found this product sooner.
Worked great on my Burberry boots
Got rid of the white spots on my Joules rain boots

This stuff is amazing !!!!!!!  Don't normally write reviews, had too with this item. Purchase because I was unable to wear my black rain boots. They had a grayish discoloration all over them from normal wear. I purchase this last week,  followed application directions,  "OMG it works". My boots are gorgeous again.
Also, applied to other boots, they are refreshed. Saved me tons of money. If you need to restore your rain boots/ boots  back to life, get it, you'll  be happy you did. Try this product before you purchase new boots. Follow the directions, you cant go wrong and "Less" than $10.00 !!!!!!
PERFECT FOR RUBBER BOOTS made my rain boots look brand new, even after getting wet with the rain. Great product

It works!! I bought a pair of not-so-cheap rubber rain boots in black only to discover the rubber turned grey quite quickly. Only with done serious bugging could I get them black again but only for a very short period. I basically gave up on them until I found this spray. I used as directed outside and even though they didn't return the boots to completely black rubber they definitely look much better- to the point that Ill wear them proudly again! I waited over night to see if the color would last at it hasn't faded at all. Ill check back in later to update the review when it wears off. Pictures in comments. Before and afters, plus side by side comparison. Great stuff!!
summary: Brought my boots back to respectable life.

reviewText: Worked wonderful on my Hunter boots!

This product is great! I had a pair of brand new green Hunter rainboots that began to bloom almost immediately after purchase. If you own Hunter boots, you know what I'm talking about- the grayish film that completely ruins the look. I'd tried water, soap, and all the "from your pantry" recipes online- like olive oil and Dawn- to remove the bloom, but nothing had worked. Enter this spray! It took about 5 sprays per boot, but with an old t-shirt and a little bit of scrubbing, the bloom came off immediately and has stayed off since. Can't beat the price!
summary: Totally removed the bloom from my Hunter rainboots!

reviewText: The bottle of Joules Buffer Up Rain Boot Gloss Spray was delivered in a plastic-lined envelope without a cap.  The package was a mess since a lot of the liquid was outside the bottle.  After handling the bottle with product all over it, I realized the label advises not getting it on skin.  Greeeaaaaaaaat.
works perfectly

This product is NOT a cleaner. Boots must be washed and allowed to airdry before applying product. This product adds back the shine to the boots after they've been worn and cleaned. I have a pair of rubber boots that the wax has "bloomed" on. This product helps to disguise the white coating that now marrs my boots but does not fix the problem.  I have also used this product on a pair of Joules that I've had for a few years and worn quite gently. reviewText: easy to use and works wonders

As a big fan of Joules brand, I expected their boot gloss spray to be of the same high quality as their other products. I was not disappointed. This was used on two pairs of rain boots (one of which was Joules) and a pair of duck flats. It was super easy to use. Once the shoes were cleaned, you just spray the Joules Buffer Up Rain Boot Gloss Spray and wipe. I've used a soft cloth and paper towel. Both worked fine. I was really impressed by the level of shine this spray produces. The boots pictured aren't super shiny, so not the best example of finish, but note the boot on the right (which has been treated with the Buffer Up Rain Boot Gloss Spray) is shinier than the one on the left. The finish is shiny but not sticky. I highly recommend.
summary: Perfect spray to refresh your rain boots.

reviewText: My black Hunter rain boots were pretty much completely gray because the rubber had begun to cloud, but this spray actually restored the color back to their natural color. I truly wasn't expecting this spray to work that well, but can honestly say I was pleasantly surprised.

reviewText:
It does what is says. It only shines the shoe. The product does not clean the boot though. I really use my boots to muck around the yard so they were pretty dirty.  After quite a bit of use I decided to try the Joules Buffer Up. Direction say to wash dirt off first, I hosed mine down and used a sponge to get the majority of the muck off. Then it says to let them air dry. Then you apply the spray and polish it off similar to shining shoes.

Results: They are pretty shiny again, but next time I will really take the time to clean them well before shining them as this stuff doesn't remove any dirt at all.

I attached photos of before, after just washing & airs dry, and after the buffer spray.

I LOVE these shoes, but have only owned them about 2 weeks. I live in Seattle and am a Mariner and Seahawks fan. The color of these, TOXIC, is perfect! Depending on the light, they are blue or lime green! However, I have not used them for cardio yet. I am a gal with a small, but wide foot (usually lady's size 4.5 B) and was apprehensive about this 'Unisex'/male sizing. I ordered the smallest size 4D and it fits well! I am elated with the fit and comfort. Warning: it is called a "Minimus" shoe, so there is very little padding or support. Great shoe for the gym & wt lifting, but NOT for running or any high impact. You want style, comfort, and attention? Add these to your wardrobe!
This shoe is so lightweight and comfortable that you'd think you're wearing your slippers.

I bought these hoping they would be a good replacement for my worn-down MR00 Minimus, and have been very disappointed. I used the MR00s mainly as trainers for gym workouts and really loved their no-frills, low-profile approach. Unfortunately, the 200 Trainers don't live up to my experience with the MR00 for a number of reasons.

It starts with the outsole. The MR00 had a flat outsole that gave you good stability for weightlifting and enough traction for agility work. The 200 Trainers have sufficient traction, and the outsole seems at least as durable as the MR00's, if not more so. But the outsole on the 200 Trainers is curved to the shape of the foot. It feels fine anatomically, but the curvature is pronounced enough that there's a little wobble to them on flat surfaces. Not to the point of being dangerous, but definitely something I was conscious of when squatting or performing weighted single leg exercises.

The upper, though it appears durable, is also a step back from the MR00 in my opinion. The front of the 200 Trainers is a stiff reinforced material that isn't as comfortable against the toes as the material of the MR00. While you could throw on the MR00 sockless and not feel uncomfortable, I can't say the same for the 200 Trainers. The lockdown of the midfoot is good, but I wouldn't say that was a problem I had with the MR00.

The real dealbreaker though is the heel. It's flexible and comfortable, but doesn't have enough structure to withstand rigorous activity. I knew I was done with the 200 Trainer when I literally walked out of them while doing sled pushes. It didn't matter how tight I tied them, the heel is just so flexible that I would push out of them after a few steps. For a trainer, this level of performance is just unacceptable.

New Balance has done some good things with this shoe, but overall it's just not a worth replacement to the MR00, and not at all worthy of the label "trainer."

reviewText:
A minimalistic, barefoot style, glove like fit and zero drop shoe. I would say this is New Balances take on the Vivobarefoot Motus. The outsole is tough and durable yet totally flexible, has a sort of a rounded shape to mimic natural foot contours. Rough measurement is the outsole is around 3 to 4mm. A difference to Vivos is the UX200 has a midsole of around 3 to 4mm which adds a tiny bit of cushion. This is very welcome as the Vivos are near impossible for walking on concrete and its not natural for humans to be walking on that hard a surface, whereas the UX allows for concrete with the slight added cushion. But remember this is still next to nothing compared with any other shoe.  No insole either, allows for better ground connection
To wear this form fitting glove like shoe you must get the correct size, ie way smaller than you think. Your feet and body must be in good strong shape with well formed arches.  Can take years to transition to this type of shoe. My foot is 270 mm at the longest toe, arch up, knees straight, no pronation or supination in lower leg. Legs inline with hips and outside edge of feet facing directly forward. I have size a 9US and fit is perfectly snug, that is my foot fills entire shoe at every point with toes almost touching end. I am 6 foot 2 tall and before transitioning to barefoot shoes used to wear size 11.5US runners and have progressively downsized. Takes many many shoe pairs of decreasing sizes to get down to perfect size, realigning feet and legs. Most people are wearing shoes too big for themselves , causing foot and body problems. This is opposite to the convention thinking of sizing up, exactly form fitting fit is what is required.
New Balances best minimalist shoe ever. Hope this is successful and stays around for a long time.
summary: New Balances best minimalist shoe ever.

reviewText: The size it is too large

These are great IF you know what you're using them for and why. A lot of people get these kinds of shoes as some kind of "macho" statement or because they're a "fad," but they were really conceptualized and designed with serious purpose in mind, promoting a balanced way of being closer to nature that goes far beyond just the mere athletic.

These shoes are for trail-walking and running but NOT for beginners since the minimal vibram sole will make the feet of beginners so sore, they won't be able to walk straight for a week. They feel like socks on your feet, that's how light they are! To get the maximum benefit of a shoe like this, you have to develop your full stride first, which, you cannot do without shoes like this that imitate or at least allow you to be "almost barefoot" and feel the ground in minute detail. For beginners who think they have the patience for this kind of training, I recommend the standard New Balance Minimus trail shoe which has slightly less ground feel but more arch support and ground grip on dirt trails.

https://www.amazon.com/New-Balance-Mens-MT10V4-Trail/dp/B015XCQSV4/ref=pd_sim_309_4?ie=UTF8&refRID=T0YBAGJS5F1VD5CB3GHC

I would train every other day on a trail with lots of uphills using the standard New Balance for one month and then starting the second month, I would use these even more minimal shoes once a week. After 4 months of hiking every other day, you should be able to use the UX200V1's every time. You have to go slow and concentrate on rudiments to the point of making sure each step you put on the floor is flat with a mid foot contact with the ground while YOU remain in far more control of your stride than gravity or momentum. This way each step is a soft landing with the force of the impact with the ground evenly distributed throughout your entire body and not just distributed into your foot and legs. It takes a couple of months of every-other-day slow training and maximum concentration on balanced landing on trails with all kinds of rocks and slopes for your feet to get strong enough so that the soreness only takes a couple of hours to relax itself and go away. But once that's done, the leverage you get from a stride that is balanced and fully controlled at all times is like having a bicycle with 50 gears. Slight movements of the legs, your feet, your body position, your arms, etc. all start making a huge difference and you start to get tired less and less. The next thing you notice is that few people can keep up with you because your strides become almost as fast as slow jogs, especially on uphills.

Also, as long as your landings are skillful, you glide over the ground with only the minimum contact necessary to propel you forward and the ground, especially ground made up of rocks and boulders and asphalt, will MASSAGE your feet and transfer stored energy into you. Yes, you read that right: if you do this kind of training right, you will be able to massage your feet on hard rocks and soft asphalt and absorb energy from the ground at the same time, while walking, jogging or running! lol  Running correctly in minimal style is not as "easy" as some people assume. It's not supposed to be done with the traditional runner's way of striking the foot to the ground. You have to learn to absorb impact in an entirely new way. Then you speed it up very gradually, never losing sight of the foundations built on how your feet contact and deal with the ground, until you have the jogging or "running" pace you want. .

This kind of training is really the wave of the future from the past, since for thousands of years people had minimal padding on their shoes. This is for those who want to be OF the mountain and OF the hill and canyon, not fighting the elements but in balanced harmony with them. I'd say they're more for those who meditate while they're training or for those who approach training as a form of meditation.
summary: Athletics for Meditation and Meditation through athletics

This is a light nylon raincoat. It is waterproof (see water test in my video). This raincoat is not warm but it works very well to protect from rain. The tricky part is to get the size right. Asian sizes are different from American sizes (typically two sizes smaller) and not all sellers make it clear if the drop down list with sizes shows American or Asian sizes. Do not use the link to the chart size at the top of the listing. The seller included Sizing table in the product description. When I measured my raincoat with the measuring tape and compared it to the size chart they were accurate within one inch and my raincoat is a good fit. The raincoat includes a detachable hood and belt. The raincoat closes with large buttons and the hood is attached by 4 small buttons. This raincoat is provided to me by Bluetime to test the product and fit as part of a new product introduction. Ali Julia review
summary: Sizing is tricky - use sizing chart in the product description

reviewText: Very nice key fob holder. Both sides come with chains and 2 rings (one medium, one small) to hold your keys in place and prevent them from falling out. This little key fob protector is very cheaply made and really doesn't do the job.  My Nissan Pathfinder key fob fits inside with way too much room to spare, consequently, it moves all around inside the zippered pocket.  The outer plastic "window" that is supposed to allow me to use the key fob, is cloudy, not clear and I can't see the buttons on the key fob at all, making it useless.  The back zippered compartment has this very cheap longish chain, to which I am apparently supposed to attach a spare key or two.  It would make more sense to have three stationary key rings at the top of the compartment.  This key fob is not well thought out and is not functional.  I won't send it back but I won't use it either.  Don't waste your money.

I went with the white and the picture is accurate to what you get. Also the sticker is really cool and looks cool on my dinosaur of a laptop. I would definitely buy this pack again and recommend it to a friend. :)

I'm 5'3, 100lbs and this costume fit pretty well. I took a risk but considering this costume was available on other sites for three times the price, I decided it was worth the gamble. It was just a little loose, but still super cute/sexy. (I definitely rocked santacon). I really liked the back of this costume; it has a petticoat type fabric underneath to accentuate your butt and give you a great shape.

Just fyi, this costume is definitely too short in the front/open to be worn by itself with just some large underwear. The part that laces up the front is completely see through, so I wore a bodysuit underneath (which I purchased from amazon for around $12 with prime shipping). I didn't feel too slutty and I pretty much rocked SantaCon Cincinnati. Would recommend and will be wearing next year :)

PS. My costume did not smell and was not itchy as mentioned by previous reviewers. Also, the fabric was high quality.

reviewText: It's wrong size too large for
Beautiful suite!

Greetings fellow amazonians, just bought this suit a few weeks ago and it helped me out big time. You see  one reason I haven't been able to give as many reviews over the past few years is because I was in jail.  The only access I had to the internet was in the prison library, but I was not able to go often because I was not labeled a "good" prisoner. I had a parole meeting scheduled a few weeks back and I wanted to look good so I bought this suit. I had it delivered to one of the COs  houses that owed me a favor and he snuck it in for me. I put it on and my cellie Big Todd was really impressed. I went to the meeting and to my shock I was not supposed to dress up for it. They wanted me to show up in that ugly orange jumpsuit for some reason. I decided to tell the parole board the whole story as to how I got the suit and some other lurid details of what went on while I was behind bars.  The entire time though I noticed that the board members were not really listening to me, but admiring this suit. After about an hour of me spilling my guts about spilling guts I finished and waited for the board members to respond. It was like they were under a spell or something, but just then they awoke and voted on letting me out. I couldn't believe it I was out and free to join my carnival again thanks to this suit and amazon.

Can't review it.  CAn't order it.  I'm 6'4' and weigh 190 lbs.  I would buy a couple, just to have, but my sleeves are 36", and chest is 44"; pants are 37 x 34.

I don't think these have been tailored for the rest of us North American men.

reviewText: This was the first clicker I've ever gotten. Understandably it was difficult to adjust to putting it in. I had to cram my fingers into my nose to hold the hinge bar in place. It was mildly uncomfortable trying to get it to click in place and likewise trying to unlatch it. Once in I had no problems with it. If only work would allow me to openly display mine it wouldn't be a problem. Otherwise it's great and gets lots of compliments. It's a nice piece of bling and apparently the whole thing (post and decorative fan) is surgical steel as it hasn't changed colors or irritated my skin. So I can look past the hassle of putting it in/taking it out. I just need to give myself time to fight with it.
summary: Otherwise it's great and gets lots of compliments

reviewText:
Dainty, Delicate and Dazzling with Tiny Crystals, this Rose Gold Plated Pave Necklace and Earring Set by SmitCo LLC is perfect for Adults as well as Teens and Pre-Teens!
Both the 1/2" Rose Gold Plated Heart Charm and 3/8" Matching Heart Shaped Earrings are studded with Faceted Crystals that sparkle like diamonds when the light hits them.
The Heart is hung from a Sturdy 15 1/2" Rose Gold Plated Link Chain which features a chain extender along with an easy to manipulate Lobster Claw Clasp.
I love that the Chain is strung through openings on either side of the Heart Charm, as there is no bale from which it can come loose.
The Matching Heart Earrings feature Rose Gold Plated Barrel Backs.
Smitco LLC ships this beautiful Rose Gold Plated Pave Heart Necklace and Earring set in a pretty gift box complete with a satin bow attached to the lid.
I received my necklace and earring set at a reduced cost in exchange for offering my honest and unbiased opinion.
Giving it, and the company that sells it  a well deserved 5 Star Recommendation!
summary: This Rose Gold Plated Pave Necklace and Earring Set by SmitCo LLC is perfect for Adults as well as Teens and Pre-Teens!

reviewText: Warm, thick and great quality. America!

The best scarf EVER!  This thing is 25 inches wide, and over 70 inches long!  Folded in half long wise, the width is still 12 1/2 inches.  With the double layer it is very, very warm!  When I'm cold outside, I just put this on and wrap around my neck once and I am nice and warm in minutes.  It even gets a little hot!  Loosening a little helps that if it's too hot!  But I like it hot!  I'm probably going to get another one for a backup!

Every time I wear it somewhere, I get tons of compliments on it.

Love the "faded glory" look of the scarf. Its lengthy enough to actual wrap around my neck and function as a scarf, rather than a novelty look. Only downside I found was, I took it directly from the package and wore it to class. when I got home, I had fuzz from the scarf in my beard. Not sure if laundering it will help.
summary: Love the "faded glory" look of the scarf

I ordered the silver bracelet (Silver Style A, with the "T's"). It arrived today from overseas around 28 days before the expected arrival date which was nice. I didn't even know that Tiffany & Co made a style similar to this, but I liked it because my husband's name starts with a T. I think the bracelet is dainty and classy looking.
My wrists are one of the only parts of me that are still small (6") and personally I didn't have to expand it at all to get it on, so re-aligning it won't be an issue for me, but may be an issue for others as the metal is thin.  Overall I like it a lot, the quality seems good and it's very shiny, nice enough compared to any other costume jewelry I own. After I have had it for awhile I will come back and update my review if needed.

I purchased this product at a reduced or promotional rate in exchange for an honest review and unbiased feedback. All opinions expressed within my review are 100% my own as well as any photos I have provided.

reviewText: These tags are great. Putting ones luggage through the airlines is very much like the old American Tourister where a gorilla is slamming the baggage around. I normally use the paper tag provided at the baggage drop area and the last few times I traveled those have come off the carousel and all that was left was the string. It's too late to worry about having decent ID on your luggage when it's lost. These tags are very robust. The cable attachment method with the screw closure is very secure and versatile. One could easily move from one bag to another and they do not come off. Plus it helps in respect to recognizing which case is yours. Great product.

reviewText:
My regular shoe size is 7.5 narrow, and I've worn 8.5 mediums in New Balance running shoes and walking shoes for years.  I ordered this shoe to replace a pair of New Balance Country Walkers that took a beating in Death Valley this past autumn.  This shoe (size 8 l/2 medium) runs short on my foot, the toes of my right foot bumping into the toe of the shoe, and just a small bit of space between my toes and the toe of the shoe on my left foot. There was a second problem with the shoe that I might have adjusted too if not for the problem with the length--the shoe bed is very flat, no arch support at all, and very hard.  All in all, the shoe isn't as comfortable as my old New Balance Country Walkers .  The length problem was a surprise, because 8 l/2 New Balance shoes have always worked in the past.

It's a nice looking shoe, a little dressier than the old Country Walkers, and the pink highlights of the chocolate bungee shoe are very understated. You hardly notice the pink stitching, it just adds little bit of decoration to the shoe.

I've returned the shoes and Amazon was great about processing a fast refund.  I'm going to try repairing the torn heel of my old Country Walkers with Shoe Goo and see if I can get by with them until I can try on some NB country walkers in a store, just in case New Balance has changed their sizing or their lasts.
summary: the shoe isn't as comfortable as my old New Balance Country Walkers

reviewText:
Much higher quality than anticipated for the price!

Delivery Time - It took a long time to deliver, but that was expected. I had no problem with it at all, just something to be aware of.
Quality - The material is thick and sturdy, which was a nice surprise. It seems like it will be very durable. The part that connects the straps to the purse is metal, not cheap plastic. A+

Surprise Perk - The bottom of the bag "unzips" to expand. This was great and I can fit quite a bit in the bag.

Con - With stuff in the purse it doesn't really look very 2D, but I think the bag is cute overall and don't really mind. If you just have a few flatter things in the bag, it will look 2D. I just stuff it pretty full.

(multi-colored beaded cuff)
As in my previous review of this product, in different colors, I indicated that I have a problem with each of three items I purchased from this seller, and can't begin to say they were in the least cooperative, pleasant or helpful about it.  This bracelet is pretty, but quite 'unfinished'. It is more interesting, it's more advanced, has a nicely 'finished' border, which indicated and follows a 'finished' braided style, which is quite nice. I think they can do better by virtue of this example of their abilities, so I hope they can learn to expand upon this more advanced design.  I find that there are still entirely too many open ends, where the wires aren't hooked closely enough, they still 'catch' on absolutely everything, and will ruin clothing of any type, irreparably.  It's too bad, I think with a little more care and perhaps more time, these bracelets, or 'cuffs',show promise.
Again, the attitude of the seller is another issue, so I'll let other customers reactions help to influence reactions to that, but good luck, nonetheless. suzette
summary: Okay, this won't catch on jeans, so you're okay with those, but still be careful about your top! Nice Braid Pattern!

This skirt is absolutely adorable. The color is perfect for what I'll be using it for. I originally thought that the straps would annoy me, but they're super comfortable and stretchy, which means a lot to someone with a large bust (G's)!

However, I do have to drop down one star because, as some of the previous reviews have pointed out, the actual stitching on the garment is horrendous. It doesn't show on the right side of the skirt (much - some uneven stitching), but it's pretty clear that whoever sews these doesn't have a clue on how to properly thread their machines. Either that, or they don't know how to reinforce the ends of each stitch! Nonetheless, the pieces don't seem to be loose or ripping anytime soon, so I'm still more than happy with this purchase.

Not exactly as expected, but still LOVE! My 5yr old picked this out herself for her upcoming birthday. Wasnt supposed to arrive till afterwards so decided we'd make it a Christmas gift. Nope! Came 4 weeks EARLIER than said, so she gets it for her birthday! AWESOME!! Brownie points on that!! We opened it & i had her try it on just to make sure there would be no disappointment on her day. She LOVES it! Its SUPER soft! The hood itself is a bit high giving a cone shape, but im positive that w/ some wear it will stretch & give a more floppy look to ease! She is not worried about it, therefore i can sit back & smile that she is 100% (yes i said 100%!) excited & satisfied!!!! Absolutely adorable & very pleased! We both love how it slighty comes over the shoulders & the fact that it can be tighten if necessary and the 2 big buttons just under the face are the perfect touch!! Nice thickness for being so light also! Says its for a child in a certain age range- well my daughter is basically 6 & fits just right!! No complaints!! Even better was the quality of care in receiving a personal email (not through Amazon) from this company asking specifically if it fit my daughter & if i was satified, if i had any suggestions or even complaints. They were very interested in my person feedback. How many companies really care like that, honestly- come'on now!?! Major brownie points again!! Once my youngest daughter decides she also wants one, i will make sure i order from THIS company & hope by then they have just a couple more styles, or colors at least, so both my daughters don't have the EXACT same hood! A tiny difference would be nice & would guarantee another transaction from this household as my daughter has already asked for another kind!!! Bravo!!!

The Silver Tone Baby Feet Dangle is made specifically for a pregnant woman's belly ring hole. It's objective is to be comfortable while the abdomen is enlarging. At first, when I received it, I was thrilled to give it to my 23 year-old-daughter who is about 17 weeks pregnant. While I tried to get her to just take it out and let it close, she did not agree to that idea so this was the next best thing. She was so happy to see the cute little feet. At first when she put it on it felt okay. After about a week of wearing it and she was on the phone to me saying that it always felt as if it was pulling her skin. She felt like her skin was being ripped out were her exact words. We have ordered a few others to see if they are all the same.
summary: It's objective is to be comfortable while the abdomen is enlarging

I have 7 nieces and ordered one for each of them because during a family get-together, they were running around, picking all the puffed out dandelions and making wishes from the seeded dandelions in the field next to my house.  I saw these necklaces and thought it would be a great way to remind them about the fun they had that day.  That will NOT HAPPEN now.  These are gross, dead flowers glued shut into the glass bulbs. Compliments Compliments Compliments!  I have never received more compliments on a piece of jewelry than I have this necklace!  Shopping at the mall, I was stopped and told how gorgeous it was.  At the store picking up some snacks on the way home, I was stopped and asked where I got it because they'd never seen anything so unique and pretty.  At the restaurant, over some imitation crab meat salad, I'm told that it's beautiful and just what this one server's daughter would absolutely fall in love over.  Taking the pups for a little stroll, joggers screech to a stop to tell me of how when they were small, they'd pick these type flowers blow them into the air and make wishes until they were dizzy, and they must know where I got it so they can treat themselves to a pretty piece of their childhood that they can wear around all day.
I've had pieces of jewelry that I have loved before, and thought that they were just stunning, but never in all of my life have I ever been stopped more by complete strangers and complimented over something.  It really is that beautiful.  Can you imagine the absolute shock when I tell people that it was only around $5.00?!  lol
summary: If you are embarrassed by compliments and hate attention, don't get this.

reviewText:
The positives of these earrings are..
1. Arrived fast! I ordered two pairs of these on July 27th and received them today, August 3rd.
2. They're cute, and arrived in the the condition they are supposed to be in. No defects, rhinestones all there, etc.
3. Price. For the price you really can't beat it. Plus you can use the 'moon' part to pair with other earrings.

My only complaint is that the 'star' portion is not like the pointy one advertised. The one I received is more roundish in a blueish green color. Still cute but it give it more a little girl feel. They are like the pictures other reviewers have posted.

All in all though for price and how quickly they arrived I say they're a fun little pair of earrings!

reviewText:
Okay, so I've spent some significant time thinking about these tie holders since receiving them earlier today and wearing them. With about 6 hours of experience, and with a product like that, this being enough, here are my findings. As a disclaimer, my experience includes wearing a tie each and every day for the last 15 years. I have hundreds of ties and enjoy my ties in that I believe they are a good way to depict my mood that morning. If I am wearing a bright tie I have a lot of energy, a dark tie I am feeling quiet, etc.. . In all of my years buying, wearing and in general being a consumer of manufactured goods I have never seen such an item, so I was happy to try it out. Especially when being given the opportunity to buy it for a discounted price through another website. So, though this is my first discounted item I've received to give a review. I ask that you take my review seriously and know and trust that it is not skewed for any reason; but instead honest. This item without a questions is ingenious. It is the type of creation that makes me think of the paperclip and the thumbtack.

Pros:
It holds my tie from going in the toilet, water bowl, my soup, flipping over.. It is what it says it is.... it is a tie holder and it holds your tie back. I was interested to see how it worked and happy that it fit my shirt. I'd assume that it fits all dress shirts in that the openings are not only the size of a button but elongated openings.  The item is light, thin and smooth.  The packet came with 5 and instructions on how to use it. The packaging was substantial and kept the item safe and sound. I like this because it does what a tie clip does, without the pretentiousness of a tie clip. Many of my clients are blue collar, outdoor workers. To wear a tie when meeting them is already a stretch, to wear a tie clip is pushing it.... this will keep my tie in place on those windy days without compromising the way they perceive me and leave them questioning if I find myself to be better than them because I have fancy jewelry on my neck tie.

Cons:
Very few, just that the item has its manufacturers name all over it. This makes for an unsightly sitatuion when the tie does move a little and someone may be looking, then again, I have been focused on it all day so I may be the only one noticing.

Simply, I really like this product. Though, I must be honest it is about as exciting as a collar stay once you get use to it. I can see wearing one of these daily and the benefit would be that I can see having it for a long long time because I cant take off my shirt without noticing it, u nlike a collar stay which too often gets sent to the cleaners never to return.

To anyone that wears dress shirts or may be planning an outside party (that requires a tie), I'd buy a set.. well worth it.

Now.. on to the disclaimer, and feel free to read my other reviews if you question my integrity...

I received the product for a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This is my honest review with no intention to mislead anyone looking to purchase this item. Please feel free to ask more question and I'll be happy to look and provide a response.
summary: Intersting little gadget, Anyone that owns a dress shirt and tie should have a set. Much like owning collar stays. Good product!

reviewText:
Have you ever wondered "Why didn't I think of that?" Well this is one of those times for me.  I have a husband and four sons who have gone through dozens of expensive ties over the years because a tie tack or bar snagged that one little thread that ran, and they have lost enough tie tacks and bars to start a small jewelry store.  I learned early to keep spares hidden in the car so we would not have ties waving when we arrived at church or special occasions.  I have resorted to using one of my stud earrings on occasion to prevent it.
These tie holders are sheer genius.  They hold ties securely, you don't see them floppy in the wind and they lie nice and flat against shirt.  Tfhey are easily attached to the buttons of a dress shirt, and through the little label on a tie. You should make sure this is securely attached to the tie..  I agree with another review that the logo is a little large, but you can't see it behind the tie. I will be ordering more because one of the boys will be running by to borrow a tie tack or bar from Dad. If he's lucky, he will get to keep one.  I received these at a promotional price in return for a review of the product.  My reviews are intended to assist others..
summary: Great tie bar/tack alternative, easy to use

reviewText:
Like they say, 3 easy steps and you'll look awesome.  Or at least your tie will be held awesomely in place.
Easy to highly recommend this little gadget.

Pros:
All the ties I've tried fit the tie holder through with no problem.
All the shirts I tried (I'm a size 16.5 - 32/33 in case it maters) had buttons that lines up with no problem.
The clear style is nice, for the most part these are rather invisible.
No holes in my ties, no clip marks, the clear color matches about everything.
Due to the tight button holes, there is no way this is falling off.

Cons:
The button holes are a bit tight.  It takes some dexterity to get the buttons in there.
Taking a shirt off takes some remembering that this is there (awkward in some situations)
The logo is a bit... big and the "clear" is a bit shiny.  Both of these take away from the invisible-ness... if this matters to you.  But this does help from them getting lost in a drawer.

I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest review.
I take the task of reviewing very seriously and would not risk my integrity by giving a misleading review.
If this review was helpful to you, please take a second to press the Yes button below.

Whats great about it: ships quickly, looks like the picture, stays inflated
Whats not so great: Have to change the batteries out every 4 hours

At about the beginning of October I started thinking about what would be a good outfit to wear for Halloween. I knew that I had a lot of costume parties that I would be attending and that I wanted to make a bold statement this year. When I finally came across this outrageous costume, I knew that I needed to get it.

The costume arrived right on the time that it said it would. The package however, looked like it was just put into a bag and then ducted taped and sent out for delivery. It shipped to the correct address without any complications or problems though. When I put on the costume it had 3 draw strings that held the air in; one around the waist, and two around the ankles. The costume then had a fan that could clip right onto your hip that distributed the air throughout the costume. The fan needed four AA batteries that were not included with the package. When I turned on the fan the whole costume was inflated in less than 30 seconds. As I wore the costume around, I had not problems keeping the costume on, and the air seemed to stay in moderately well. You do however, need to keep the fan on at all times while you are wearing the costume. It was a great outfit for walking around and hangout out, but I would not recommend any strenuous activity while wearing the costume because the air will not keep in. Four hours into the night I noticed that the fan was starting to slow down and air was not going into the costume as well as it was when I first turned it on. That is about the time that I had to switch batteries. As soon as I changed the batteries, the fan then continued to circulate the air as normal again.

Overall, my experience with the Unicorn Fancy Dress Costume was a positive. I had no negative experiences with this product and would buy it again in a heartbeat. If you are looking for a fun outrageous costume that will make bold memorable statement, then this is the right costume for you. If anyone has any questions about the product leave a comment to my review and I will get back to you.
summary: Inflatable Unicorn Adult Fancy Dress Costume

reviewText: Nice wallet.

I bought this wallet for my husband, and he is very pleased.  It came beautifully packaged- in a handsome box, and inside the box it was wrapped in a felted envelope.  There are plenty of credit card slots on either side, with 2 hidden slots and the money section ( divided- 2 sides for bills) is lined with what looks like a silver lining, but is actually made from recycled plastic bottles. It is lined with RFI security  material to protect your important information from scanners.  The outside is beautifully stitched and embossed. This would make a wonderful gift!  I received this at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest review.  I'm happy to give it a good one because it would be well worth the full price!

I like having the CC pockets, for kroger, cvs, costco cards and more. The leather smells and looks great! Size and fit is perfect!

Let me preface this review by stating that I had a really tough time deciding between four and five stars.

This is a beautiful wallet. I was truly impressed when I took this out of the package. The leather is soft and supple. In the main slot area, it has a large capacity, four cards per side. It can hold more underneath/behind the main slots.
For bills, there is a divider in the bill section, giving it two spots for bills, allowing for better organization of currency.

Why did I give this wallet four stars instead of five? I ordered the brown wallet. I was slightly disappointed when I opened the package to find that the wallet is more of a burgundy color. This was mentioned in other reviews, but the picture looked completely brown, so I thought they might be wrong. I contacted the wallet manufacturer, and they offered a refund, and informed me that they would be changing the color description for the product. I am opting not to return the wallet though.

Overall, I like the wallet enough to offset the disappointment of color inaccuracy. I do recommend this product.
Outstanding quality. Tested and worked 100%.  Planning to order several more as gifts for family members.  Security combined with great look and feel.  Thank you. Top Rating !!
summary: Security seemlessly combined with great fashion and feel. Highly recommend to modern tech savvy consumers.

reviewText:

Plenty of room for credit cards and license, but these compartments are somewhat tight--cards won't fall out!  Divided bill compartment.
My one disappointment is that the color is not as shown on Amazon.  The color is very strongly red-brown more like cordovan.
I like the color, leather, number of credit card slots & cash pockets. I haven't as yet checked the RFID blocking ability.

I receive this wallet at a discount and this review reflects my unbiased opinion.

reviewText: Just what I was looking for

This is one of the best wallets I have ever owned throughout my life. I was wanting a good quality RFID wallet that actually worked and after many days of research I found one. This wallet is very sleek, luxurious and very nice in detail and quality.  It has lots of storage for my rewards cards and debit cards. The divider was very nice to organize coupons and receipts away from money. What I really liked was when I received the wallet it was packaged nicely in a nice black box with a cloth sheath to protect it. And it had a personalized card inside that described the wallet. And upon shippment seller contacted via email to make sure the product was as I expected and made sure I like it and was willing to make it right of I did not.  I have shown and recommended this wallet to all my co workers and family for these reasons.

reviewText:
From the first moment I took this wallet out from the package, what really caught my attention is its softness. The leather is really soft and flexible, which makes it very comfortable as it bends easily to adapt with the body. Here is my feedback on the capacity and the look of this wallet. Apparently, I cannot confirm whether it blocks RFID signals as I have no idea how to test that.

 Capacity. Although the wallet is bi-fold but it has plenty of card slots. There are 4 card slots at each side in addition to two pockets under the card slots, where I usually keep my ID, and two cash slots. In the attached pictures, the wallet included 2 ID cards, 3 credit cards, and 5 loyalty cards in addition to two folded pieces of paper.
 Look and feel. As I mentioned before, I like the softness of this wallet, which makes it comfortable. It is also relatively slim.

Overall, I am satisfied with this product. It is well-made, spacious, and came in a fancy gift package as appears in the attached pictures. I would like if it has a transparent slot for the ID.

I received this product at discount in exchange for a review.
summary: Elegant and spacious wallet with soft leather

reviewText: It feels like a cheap piece of leather. And there's no clear slot for ID. No idea how its rfid protected. It's thinner than a regular wallet. I don't like it.
summary: It feels like a cheap piece of leather

reviewText:
I received this product at a discount in exchange for my unbiased review.

I am very hard on wallets, both in use and judgement.  For me, a wallet needs to be perfect as it is something that has to be carried and dealt with everyday.  This is a good wallet, so far.  The leather feels very nice, and it is an attractive design.  I appreciated the fact that the logo is pressed in, rather than being something obnoxious and colorful.  Your views on that last statement may very but in my opinion, a wallet should be appreciated  by the carrier and totally unremarkable to everyone else, like a guy in a nice suit at a coffee shop.  The stitching is sturdy and the amount of space available is more than adequate.  My one and only gripe is that it is larger than I typically carry but that is most definitely not a negative for the wallet in it and of itself.  It is pure personal preference.  The RFID blocking function works. This was tested my taking a security tag from a clothing item and putting it through a store security scanner.  The scanner beeped.  I then repeated the process with the RFID tag inside this wallet and the scanner did not beep.
summary: Good wallet for those seeking a little peace of mind.

reviewText:
I thought about giving it 4 stars but, only because of my personal preference in it's size.  This wallet does everything it claims to.  The packaging is perfect for gift giving.  I would have preferred about a 1/4 inch shorter since that is what I am used to.  I know I will get accustomed to the slightly larger size in no time.  In this day and age, security of your credit cards, license, etc. should be a top priority.  I had my identity stolen once before and I NEVER want to go through that again.  I purchased this wallet to take on vacation.  It is soft enough out of the box that you really don't have to 'break it in'.  However it is also well stitched with plenty of slots and room for most anyone's credit cards and I.D.s.
It is now my permanent  wallet.
summary: well stitched with plenty of slots and room

reviewText: Genuine Full Grain Leather RFID Blocking Wallet by Secret. The Genuine Full Grain Leather RFID Blocking Wallet by Secret isn't just like any other wallet, it is very lightweight and feels really premium, yet keeping itself very slim. The build quality is just fantastic, the stitching is on point and it is very precise. The genuine leather build makes it feel much more exclusive and reliable. The wallet has two bifold sections, or LARGE BILL compartments in this case, to place your paper money in, and multiple card holding pockets, 8 as mentioned in the product description. Not to mention the packaging that was quite impressing, highly protective, and very presentable in a black mysterious box! As for the RFID blocking capability, I haven't really been able to test it because I don't have a tool nor do I know any RFID identity stealing machines. So in my overall usage of 6 months, it has sustained the toughest situations and tests a wallet could ever go through! I would give this wallet 5-stars, based on all the points mentioned above such as the build, presentation, and the capabilities of the wallet itself, not the mention the exclusive price point of $15 at the time. Overall, this is a wallet that I would definitely recommend, especially for myself, close relatives, and friends. I had received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Genuine Full Grain Leather RFID Blocking Wallet by Secret

This is a very good looking wallet, independently of the benefits of having an RFID blocking wallet, this is one that actually my husband wants to use, just because of looks and quality.
The leather is very soft, and it is well finished. It is also very spacious, and has a lot of mini pockets to keep all items in their place, it has space for 8 credit cards or card size items.
Once you look inside, you will notice that it has kind of a very thin metal mesh that is precisely what blocks someone from stealing your credit card data. But even with that, it folds very slim. This is specially useful if you travel abroad a lot, since credit card data robbery is more common in other countries than here.
If you are thinking of getting this wallet as a gift, it comes inside a very nice box and covered with a cloth, and looks very elegant since the moment you receive it and open it.
I am very pleased with this wallet and I was lucky to get it with a discount, this review reflects my honest opinion and I hope you find it useful.
summary: Looks and feel very elegant and you are protected

I started to read up on how people could get your info off a chip card if they have the technology.  It got me thinking that this would probably get worse so it couldn't hurt.  So I bought the little covers and they fit perfectly in my wallet with my cards.

So I was looking for a new wallet for my husband. He doesn't want it to thick because he keeps it in his pocket.  He really just wanted a bifold since he had a trifold before and it was thick. He needed quite a few slots for his various cards.  I came across this on Amazon and read all the good reviews. I decided to go for it. I felt it was nice looking and would protect him.

He loves it . He always comments how it's the right thickness and he liked the feel of it. It remained thin even with all his cards and we have the little extra security of making sure someone can't steal information.

Purchased this for my mom; she carries her yorkies with her as a service dog and didn't have a safe place to carry her wallet.  She put a clip on the chain for this wallet so that she can clip it straight on the dog carrier and she now has a safe place to carry her cards and cash.  This wallet also has several side pockets so that she had several places to organize her things into.  It fit her personal style perfectly.  The seams were all well stitched and the wallet holds a generous amount of money, receipts and cards easily.  The zipper zips and unzips smoothly without any snags or without catching on the material.  My mom is very happy to have this option for safely carrying her money with her now; she no longer had to worry about her wallet falling out of the side of the dog carrier.

I use this for change in the car.  It's too big for most people to carry around in a pocket -- it would be fine for a purse or briefcase -- but I tend to accumulate a lot of change and this suits my needs just to have to grab when I go into a store.

My brother had a similar coin purse that he had purchased at a dollar store some years back. It was wearing out and finally broke beyond repair. He tried to get another but no one carried them. He's not internet savvy, I told him that I bet I could get it on Amazon. While still talking to him on the phone I found this one which was upscale from the one he had. I confirmed the description, and ordered it to be delivered to his house as he lives a few hours away. The order was placed on a Saturday night. I have Prime so it shipped free and he had it Monday afternoon. He was surprised and delighted. He says the quality is excellent and it has a few more compartments than his old one. The only remaining question is how long will it last, and the only way to find out is to wait.

The most helpful review anyone posted was from the seller stating that this is made from thick cow hide. I am so glad I grabbed one of these based on that information! I have a Marshal Womens Leather Change Purse w/ Key Ring (Black) which is this same style wallet that only lasted about a year before the edges of credit cards started to cut through the soft supple thin leather. This one is nice thick leather. I wouldn't call it "stiff" but it certainly isn't thin and supple. I want this to last 10+ years and it seems that it certainly will. The zippers work perfectly and seem to be great quality. I have to note that it had an unpleasant odor that I noticed for at least 2 or 3 weeks before it went away. Now all I smell is leather smell when I put it right up to my nose. If you find it has a smell you can't stand, I can only sympathize with you and say that if you just endure it that it will eventually go away.
summary: Nice thick cow hide. Very weird smell for about 2 or 3 weeks but it eventually went away completely.

reviewText: This wallet has so many pockets, I can group my coins. Keeps me from fishing around for the right coin. And it feels like a quality product.

This is not a shoe. It is a pouch. I have been looking for a small pouch to carry my keys other small things that I use every day for a while. This Maven leather pouch seems to be perfect. It is difficult to buy an item like this from a picture online. I'll try to give you a run down. The measurements listed are correct. 4.5" wide ,3" high and 0.5" thick loaded with my stuff. There are 4 zippered pockets. The top pocket on the long side runs the full width and height . It fits a car key and remote with ease. On one face there are 2 pockets the top one is full width and full height ,I keep a ring with 2 house keys, a 2" flashlight and a leatherman squirt. The lower pocket is full width and 1.5" deep it holds 2 keys. On the opposite side  there is a full width zipper down the center and a pocket full width and full- height with a key ring on a leather loop. Where I keep small bar code  ID cards., Nice soft leather , smooth zippers. and lined interior. A bargain for the price.

They were already borderline too short for my 5 almost 9 inch frame, but after washing they are certainly too short now. I have a fashion forward friend who makes fun of me. I let her, because when I wear these now, they truly look too short. Drives me crazy.

Other than that, they are not bad pants. Nothing is tearing, other than being too short for me, they are excellent. I just wish they were longer for taller Momma's..

reviewText: fine

Pros:
-- They fit comfortably

Update to the below.  Despite the very thin material, it was actually very comfortable once I got used to it and the belly band was helpful later in pregnancy.  I would give it 3.5 stars for the material and the price, but since I did end up wearing them quite a bit - comfortably - 4 stars is reasonable.

Cons:
-- Extremely thin "denim" material.  Would call it "denim" only by being charitable.  Thin canvas
-- Belly band poorly designed -- narrow, makes it difficult to get into the jeans
-- "Jeans" feel cheap.  For $44 dollars, it's gouging of specialty audiences.

I don't have time to return, as they are needed for a camping trip ASAP, but very unhappy with the quality.  Worried that this material will not significantly deter mosquitoes in the Everglades, and they will be useless in a Midwest winter.  Do not recommend.

I have an autoimmune disease and I have Raynaud's as a result of that. Raynaud's is a condition where you need to keep your hands and fingers warm or they can turn white then blue from a lack of blood circulation. It's painful and uncomfortable and dangerous and it's important to keep these attacks to a minimum.

So for me, I am always on the search for useful gloves and mittens when the weather turns cold. Note that I live in a warm climate - so I am not talking freezing temperatures. For freezing temperatures I would need something more like those mittens or gloves that warm up.

 Saying that, a simple trip to the supermarket can often trigger a Raynaud's attack. So I am always wearing some sort of gloves and I really like the ones that have the tips of the fingers open because they're easier to use - whether it's just holding onto things or when you want to use your devices like cell phones or touch tablets.

The fingerless gloves I normally wear are warmies - they look similar to these but they are a little heavier and they have a little pocket inside where you can place  little heat packets (you can find them online or in ski or sport shops) where you just rip the packets open, expose them to the air and put them in the pocket. They work well enough but I thought I'd try these because sometimes I find those a little unwieldy and don't always remember to have them around.

These are actually quite nice- they are thin enough so that you can easily wear them and go about your day. They also help keep my hands warm.

On the negative side, their thinness and the large openings, especially around the thumb left too much skin open to the elements. That is a problem for me as far as wearing them outside in the cold, but they fine, in fact great for inside.

If you don't have Raynaud's, and your issue with cold fingers isn't that bad, this might be a 5 star buy for you. But if you need something that truly keeps your hands warm, I am afraid these don't fit the bill.

Note - I am a female with smallish hands and these fit me perfectly. The picture gave me the impression that they went further up my arm but they don't, they really only go just past your wrists but that's actually what is shown in the picture. Just be aware of that.
summary: Not so great for those of us with Raynaud's.

My husband purchased these gloves from Amazon to put in my Christmas stocking. Unfortunately, the gloves did not arrive until just before New Year's because, even though they were listed as Prime, they shipped from China, which took around 2 weeks. I received the Light Grey, which are a soft heathered dove grey and not nearly as blue as the stock image shows. They are warm, snug, non itchy, and very soft. My hands are average to large, and the gloves stretched to cover my knuckles and wrists. The seams are well finished and flat, with no irritation on the inside. They are great for working on the computer at night, after the heat has been turned down, and for reading in bed. I thought I would wear these gloves at home only, but I find myself reaching for them over my normal gloves and mittens. I like having my fingers unencumbered, and if my fingertips feel cold, I can curl them inward and tuck them under the knit edge. I like these so much, I might pick up a few more colors. I've seen only minimal pilling, but I keep my trusty Dritz Sweater Stone handy. Eventually (after a lot of use) I've found that cashmere stops pilling. UPDATE: I have worn these gloves every day since they arrived. After wearing several hours a day, the knit started to pill, but the stone easily took care of that, and the gloves look almost as good as new. I purchased the Dark Gray, and I am seriously considering ordering yet another pair in the Wine color.
My cousin loved them! I tried ten on myself! So cozy and great fitted! They look and feel great! Very affordable and great as a gift!

Why in the world would someone give my review (below) a "not helpful" vote?  Did I say something wrong?
----------------
As a computer tech and a virtual assistant, I'm in front of a computer almost all day - five days a week.  I've developed arthritis in my fingers and thumbs over the past few years, and as those of you with arthritis know, cold weather makes it very painful to type.  My home office is poorly insulated and therefore cold 6 months of the year, but I don't like to run the heat for several reasons, and I bundle up instead.  Unfortunately, it's almost impossible to type while wearing traditional gloves, so these fingerless gloves are perfect.  I was afraid they would be bulky and not keep my fingers warm, but they're thin enough to keep your hands warm without restricting movement, and surprisingly, keep my thumbs and fingers warm.  Highly recommended!

This umbrella is about 13 in. long, so it easily slips into a bag or glove compartment to have handy for unexpected showers.  Total weight is about 16.7 oz.

The canopy has a diameter of about 40 in. when fully opened to provide protection from both sun and rain.  The fabric is unusually thick and heavy.

The shaft is metal and the rib sections are a mix of aluminum alloy and flexible fiberglass.

The handle fits nicely in the hand and has a soft-touch finish and a braided loop.  There is a button near the top that automatically opens and closes the umbrella with a strong snap, which is very convenient.  It collapses easily, ready to be opened again.

The sleeve is generously sized to accommodate the umbrella after it has been used.

Sevitti provided an umbrella for evaluation and review.

Update:  As you can see, it took awhile to go from 4 stars to 1.  I had used it once and then it sat in my truck unused for about 3 months.  .  One day I looked and the handle had spung on its own.  I couldn't close it and it would not lock open.  after a few tries I got it to close, I hit the open button and it shot across the room with the handle still in my hand.  It was enough force to fly about 15 feet.  Fortunately it did not damage anything.

reviewText: This umbrella is very nice to use. I usually use another umbrella with a canopy, especially for very windy days and sometimes the wind is still to tough for them. Also, the canopy umbrella is good for two people, sort of golf size but sometimes, these big umbrellas get in the way, a lot when walking in crowds. This particular umbrella fits my bill when I am alone, solo. It is 42 inch and I believe what makes this more windproof is the added ribs. I saw other peoples umbrellas and this one stood out of the pack with I believe it was 10 ribs rather that 8. This is definitely what makes it stronger against the winds. I finally used it and had significant winds and it did not flinch at all. Perfect. The open close feature is great. Opened great but to close was a little more harder, though not a deal breaker. Use close button than in semi-closed position, push the top closed with your hand to handle and its done. You can still close by hand by pulling it close once it has withdrawn to the semi closed position may be a little tough. I bought two of these and I am very happy I did, as its nice to have a spare for when my son visits. This is so far a definite keeper. I highly recommend it especially at this price. Will update down the road if necessary but meanwhile 5 stars is in hand.
summary: This auto open/close and windproof umbrella does its' job admirably. The extra rib design is its benefit for us for sure.

reviewText: 5/6 this umbrella did not get a lot of use until this week when it rained a lot in the east coast.  Turns out it could not take the stress of opening and closing.  It literally fell apart in my hand when I last went to open it.  Now I'm out an umbrella and no means of returning it for an exchange.  I'm feeling very cheated at the moment
Not a "Travel" umbrella. Too big and too heavy to be 'travel' in my mind. It seems very heavy and durable but not what I need when I have to deal with airlines weight limits on my luggage.

I was pleasantly surprised when I received this in the mail. This is definitely not your cheap travel umbrella from the drug store. The material is nice, thick, and sturdy. I've had several travel sized umbrellas and none have have come close. In fact, many times they have flipped with the wind as I was running to my car. It is highly unlikely that this would happen with this particular umbrella because the ribs that hold it are very sturdy and durable. It is not loose and shaky as the rain hits it. I also like that the diameter is much larger than other travel sized umbrellas. My boyfriend always refuses to use his own umbrella but always jumps under mine halfway to our destination. This always annoyed me in the past because, unless I had my large golf sized umbrella, one of us always ended up with a wet back. This particular umbrella covered us both. It wouldn't work with 2 large people but if you're small to medium or if it's you and a child, it works perfectly. The open/close button works perfectly. I like the way it pops when it opens and isn't weak like the others. The handle is also a good size and very comfortable to hold. It has a loop at the end, which I use to hang the umbrella with on my garage door. That way I can let it dry and won't forget it the next time I head out. The only negative, and the reason I didn't give it a perfect rating is that it can be a little difficult to fully push the body down into the shaft and get it to lock into close position. This can be an issue when you're trying to jump in your car quickly and close it without soaking your clothes. It took a few times in the beginning but now I know how much force I need to use. If you're looking for a nice looking, compact sized umbrella that is dependable and durable, I ecimmend this one. I obtained this product in exchange for my honest review, but that in no way influences my opinion of this product.
