At points you can see the base wig cap through the hair. The 2nd wig I got, one of the wefts in front was detached from the liner completely. I had to hand-sew it in place so it wasn't hanging down in a rectangle over my eyes.

The pigtails for the first one look all right though they are far more orange than this photo. The 2nd wig is closer in color to the picture. In case you're wondering... yeah. There's no consistency in quality here. Obviously made by different people even though they're sold by the same brand. Anyway. The clips on the first set are so tight I can barely open them. The second set are much better but have about half as much hair on them as the first. The 2nd wig is very short in the back. I thought I put it on backward the first time but no. It was just really short. The second comes to about mid-neck.

I will not be buying another of these wigs. They are not worth the price. These are $10 wigs at best.

The sturdy metal stainless steel craftsmanship guarantees a strong ,fade resistant,rust and corrosion resistant and very low maintenance and yet high quality figaro necklace. Also, you will never suffer the embarrassment of having the "green neck"syndrome you experience from those cheaply made lead and copper products. This is a premium stainless steel quality figaro necklace that is beautiful and well crafted. Also, the nice lobster claw clasp allows you to easily wear or remove the necklace without frustration and with the knowledge that your necklace will remain securely placed around your neck. I received this as a Birthday Gift from my Girlfriend and I couldn't be happier.

The Case is sturdy and I have no complaints with the build quality. Everyone always wants to critically compare these off brand items to the "namebrand" ones that are double or triple the price. You get what you pay for and I always buy the of brand option if I think its a good contender to the official one. This is certainly a great contender to the Official case from DJI. I have no complaints with the quality it actually impressed me.

The Good:
High quality zipper pulls.
Thick rugged plastic exterior (I am 180lbs and I could sit on it no problem with out worrying of crushing its contents.)
The foam is perfectly precut to hold everything snuggly.
Decent straps and padding.
Can accommodate 4 batteries.
Room for a ton of accessories (charger, props, tools, cable, and more)

The not so good:
No room for a tablet or prop guards/other larger accessories.
The rubberized matte finish was peeling off from rubbing up against the box during shipping.
No waistband strap.

For the money this is the best hardshell backpack you can get. I don't see why people would spend over $100 on a backpack. Save your money by this and the get some PolarPro filters for the same price as a DJI pack. It's a no brainer really.
summary: Best Hardshell backpack for a Phantom 3 under $100!

reviewText: It's cute and fit perfect! I'm 5'4", 108lbs, 34b and ordered small.

I'm 5'3"  about 125lbs and a 34d/34dd with little butt and no hips. I ordered a large knowing I needed a bigger top for the ladies and figured I could maybe take in the bottoms if they were too big. With Prime the bikini came in two days! The top fits great! However, I was hoping to be able to wear it on both side and the solid side just looks kinda funny (I think partially because you cant remove the pads and you can really see them on that side). I really wish you could remove the pads but I might just cut into it to remove and then re-stitch myself. The bottoms run SMALL. I normally wear a small (rarely a medium) bottom and these are a large and a little snug! I'm not just talking about the cheekiness (these are VERY cheeky - which I personally prefer), they're just snug on the hips and I don't have very big hips. There also seems to be too much material on the front of the bottoms as well, it's hard to explain. Overall this bikini is just okay.

The bikini runs incredibly small, I am typically I small, sometimes a medium (not often).  I ordered the M thinking that it would be safe, and it just wasn't going to work. I contacted Sexybody and asked for a return, and instead they offered to send me a bigger size!  I'm so pleased with their customer service, I love the style of the bikini and the design, and I was so sad when it didn't fit.  Now that they're willing to resolve the issue I'm beyond elated!

reviewText: Usually I wear a side 36 C bra at Victoria Secret. And my pant size is a 6. I ordered a medium because I read to size up, and I'm glad I did. Starting off with the top I'm super happy with it, it fit really nicely and the material is really nice too. The blue side of the top you can totally see the built in cups and I assume the cups would become  more noticeable when they get wet. Now onto the bottoms, they fit really nice around the hips. The cut of them are a little off for me. They are too thick to be a thong bikini but too small to be considered cheeky. The blue side of the bottoms I'm really disappointed. They say it's reverse able but there are visible seems on the side and also in the crotch area. So I can not wear the bottoms blue because they don't look right. Overall this is a cheap bikini and I do really like the top, I will just laid them with black bottoms.

The bottoms actually fit well. If I went up another size they would've been too big. The top however could have been a little bigger. An XL probably would've been perfect. It shows underboob a little and I have to be careful my nipped doesn't pop out. Other than that it's very cute and I'm going to keep it!

The fit is similar to the Victoria Secret itsy bottoms without the ruching. I got the peacock print and its very true to color. You can't take out the padding in the top with out cutting it open, if you were curious about that. Not a downside for me. Buy it!!!!

I prefer minimal coverage all the way around. If the back is exposing the front shouldn't look like a full coverage bikini. I feel like it should be mentioned that the top also has padding that can't be removed. I bought this top because typically the bralette style tops are flattering on girls with small chests (I'm 32 A). This top does absolutely nothing for my chest. It is very conservative and not sexy at all. If you're looking for a bikini top that is more on the modest side this one is for you. Unfortunately I would not recommend this purchase to anyone.

My wallet was starting to split on one end, so I made a purchase.  I normally like to feel a wallet in person, but I took a chance.  The wallet is very shiny and slick, making it a little easy for pick pockets or slipping out of a pocket.
The quality is nice, but the large embossing of the brand and the features (RFID, etc) is a little bit gaudy.  It would be classier to have an insert card with that info, and not emboss the leather.  It says 100% leather, but the lining can't possibly be leather, so that claim is questionable.
I like the individual card pockets for sure.  I wish it had dual bill compartments, but one problem I had is that I put a MicroSD card in my bill compartment since that's where my valuable bills are, and didn't realize there is an opening in the bottom of the bill compartment, causing it to get lost.  Many family photos and other information were lost, along with my $20 high capacity memory card.
That said, this would make a great first wallet for a young man - and comes in an elegant gift box for a nice presentation.
summary: Makes a nice gift for a young adult

I purchased this wallet in February, 2016 and it is holding up well.  The main reason I chose this wallet was for the RFID protection.  In June I went on vacation and found an opportunity to test the wallet at a hotel that used RFID key cards.  I placed my key card in the credit card slot in the wallet and held it close to the door lock.  The door unlocked!

UPDATE! 8-24-16
This wallet is showing signs of wear an guess what?  It's FAKE!  It is bonded leather over some kind of gray rubbery material.  Check my photos.  The rip off artists have struck again.

UPDATE 2-23-17
I have been using this wallet for one year now and am surprised to say that it has not deteriorated any more since my last update in August.  So, it turns out that it is a decent wallet but I will not give it a higher rating because of the deceptive advertising in my opinion.  I hope this helps you make an informed decision.
summary: NOT AS ADVERTISED.  NO RFID PROTECTION!  NOT FULL GRAIN LEATHER.  IT'S BONDED LEATHER.

reviewText: Sooooo cozy

I run between a small and a medium. Smalls are usually tight in the bust and mediums are usually baggy in the waist. I ordered a medium and it's too tight in the arms and the shoulders. I'm not exactly shaped like a linebacker, so I find that odd. The rest of the sweater fits like a small. I'm going to order it in a large and see what happens. Aside from the size, I like the jacket. It's thick and warm and seems to be well made, although I haven't had it long so I don't know how well it will hold up over time.

Edit: After receiving the Large and trying it on, it's still constricting in the shoulders, but now it's huge in the body. It's like, when they designed the sizes, they only accounted for growth in the waist and nowhere else. I wrapped a measuring tape around my shoulders and they measure just under 42 inches, so if you have shoulders smaller than mine, you'll probably be fine. Otherwise, don't expect to star in any Rocky Balboa montages, as this sweater is not designed for those maneuvers.
Came in earlier than expected. The arms happen to be a little short. Everything else looks good.

I have this in black, size M.  It is a true black and is what I expected from the product images.  (I understand that may not be the case with all colors, though.)

Because the lining is so thick, that is just a teeny bit tight.  I can still zip it up and I still have freedom of movement, but it is going to work best with thinner shirts (not thick winter sweaters).  So order up a size or two, depending on what you want to wear under this.

This is more of a casual jacket.  I'll be using it on weekends when I'm out running errands.  The zipper works well and the lining (fleece?) is soft and warm (the lining is inside the sleeves and hood, too).  This is well made with no holes or loose threads.  The sleeves are full length and this is about hip length on me (I'm 5'5").

In the end, this is warm and comfortable and it fits snugly, but it fits.  It will get used a lot this winter.

Product provided by the seller for evaluation purposes.

I was kindly sent a reviewer's sample of this hoodie for honest reviewing purposes.

* About the colour:
I ordered the "Navy Blue" version of this hoodie and the colour that arrived is a beautiful teal / turquoise. Very different from what I was expecting from the colour name and from the product photo, but luckily I like turquoise even better than navy blue so this was actually an unexpected better colour than I thought it would be!

* About the material:
The whole top feels like it's made of good quality materials. The exterior feels smooth and soft, and the whole interior is lined with furry material - and this also includes the inside of the sleeves, which makes this whole hoodie really lovely and warming, and thicker and more warming than your average hoodie.

* About the sizing:
Note the sizing runs a bit small. I ordered the Medium (106cm chest) thinking it should be nice and loose on me (my exact chest measurement is 90cm), and instead I found this was just the right size; so it's probably a good idea to order a size that shows a larger chest size measurement than you think you'll need. The sleeves are just the right length, the top isn't too loose or too tight - just right.

* About the pockets:
It has two pockets at just the right height, of just the right depth to comfortably fit your hands into.

* About the quality of the product:
Overall I was very impressed with the quality of this product, especially in terms of the materials used. The one tiny imperfection was that the plastic end of the zip had some sharp plastic edges but I filed the sharp edges with my nail-file and it's perfect now.

* Overall:
A really lovely warm hoodie in an unexpectedly nice teal colour. I think it just may be a new favourite for keeping me warm this winter!

I usually wear a small (5'5", 118lbs, long torso) but I ordered this in a medium based off the other reviews and I think that was the right choice. The medium is a bit roomy but that's how a sweatshirt should fit I think, plus the sleeves are the perfect length on me in the medium (I like sleeves to come down well past my wrist). At first I was pretty happy with this when I tried it on, the bottom band wasn't too tight (a common problem for me as my hips are disproportionately large compared to the rest of my body), length was good, the lining felt cozy and warm (though it did have a slight smell of something not very nice.... but I'm sure that would come out after the first wash), and I like the little "leather" details around the strings on the hood. But right before I ripped the tags off and threw it in the wash I tried putting the hood on and to my dismay it was WAY too short! I've never had this happen before, and I wear a LOT of hooded sweaters, so I don't think it's due to my head size. Pic attached so you can sort of see how much the shoulders of the sweater get pulled up when I have the hood on. The hood would need *at least* an extra 3 inches of length, if not more, to be comfortable. When I put the hood on, the entire weight of the sweater gets pulled on my head, since the entire sweater gets pulled off my shoulders, and it would definitely give me a headache after awhile. I actually use the hoods on my sweaters as I find it's the fastest way to warm up/keep warm when it's cold (the reason for buying this sweater) so not being able to use the hood makes this a no-go for me. If you just want a warm zip up sweatshirt and don't have any interest in using the hood, then I would still recommend this (in a size up from your usual size). But if you planned on using the hood I'd keep looking.
summary: Nice and cozy sweatshirt, but the hood is far too short making it unusable as a "hoody"

These belts are extremely long (50-51"). The first 2 belts came with an elastic loop which is slipped onto the belt and it securely holds the excess length tight against the belt. See the picture. This little loop is very important in making the belt acceptable. I have a 38 inch waist and the extra length is nearly invisible held in place by this loop. For some unknown reason, belts #3 and #4 were shipped without this loop. I contacted the seller and was told that the 2 colors I ordered did not come with a loop. And if I had looked closely at the photos displayed in the description, I would have noticed that no loop was pictured. Black and khaki get a loop and blue and camo don't get a loop. reviewText:

My only feedback is to label this not as a military or gun belt but to label it as simple a plastic buckle belt. This will allow it to bypass security checks and make it easier to buy online.

This belt is lightweight, durable, low profile, resists bending and twisting but isn't too rigid so as to be uncomfortable, and was at an incredible price point. I think I might order multiple as backups for when this one breaks down a very long time from now. I wear it with my 5.11 EMT pants and it is perfect for the job. Also, doesn't set off metal detectors which has been such a huge convenience that I don't know why I never considered a plastic buckle before!
summary: 11 EMT pants and it is perfect for the job

reviewText: This product is awesome. Since I have to walk through a body scanner the plastic belt buckle is perfect.
good

Using this as a light duty to medium duty utility belt. I'm comparing this to my 5.11 TDU 1.5in belt that I previously purchased for $18.

The buckle is made of durable plastic. Not the most durable, from the feel of it - seems like under a moderate direct blow, the plastic would crack and possibly create shards, but that is just my opinion. Buckle comparison to the 5.11 TDU belt, is this buckle makes it easier/quicker to fasten/unfasten due to its clamp design. But on the same accord, due to the clamp design, I could potentially see some issues with wear/tear on the poly-webbing over time, and possibly some slight slippage if the amount of items or weight on the belt gets heavy - but that's why I'd consider this a light to medium duty utility belt.

The length of this belt (from buckle hinge to webbing end) is 51". I'm generally wear 38" waist for comfort. When the belt is comfortably tightened around the pant waist, there's about 9.5" of belt slack left over, again measured from buckle hinge to webbing end.

Rating of 5 for a moderate economic and light duty substitute to the 5.11 TDU belt.

reviewText: Love these!!  Super simple to put in and super flexible I don't even know they are in most of the time!!!

Was having trouble with my ears long after discharge and issues are typical in a stretch. I had to go without tunnels for a week or so on a few occasions while hospitalized for medical issues and when I was discharged my ears had constricted and wouldn't let my metal tunnels back in easily which indicated to me that my ears were not healing from the stretches at all.

I suspected I was allergic to either the metal in my tunnels (paint was chipping in places) or the rubber O ring. I'd worn silicone with good results in the past and decided to give these a go.

Buying silicone tunnels online without seeing them can be a gamble but it was worth it. I've bought silicone tunnels that weren't 100% silicone and some with really odd dimensions in the past. These fit well in my ear and are exactly what they claim to be.

Irritation went away with these and some antiseptic and anti-fungal spray. Extra points for fixing my gross weepy ears.
summary: Exactly what they claim to be

reviewText: I just love this Infinity "Swiftie" Heart Pendant Necklace from Expression Jewelry.  I am a huge Taylor Swift fan and have been since she first debuted so this necklace was perfect for me.  I like that it is a piece that I haven't seen before and I get complimented on it often and asked where I got it.  The pendant is set on a 18" link chain with lobster claw grasp for easy on and off while hanging at the perfect length to not be hidden under my shirt.  The pendant is definitely bigger than I expected which was pleasantly welcomed.  It has the infinity sign with Swiftie written on the bottom loop followed by a heart symbol.  I wish I would of had this to wear to her 1989 Tour in Philadelphia this year!  Whether your a Taylor Swift fan yourself or know one this definitely makes the perfect gift for any occasion.  It is perfect to add to your own personal collection if you are a fan of hers.  I received this item at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest unbiased review. All opinions are 100% my own. If you have any questions please feel free to comment below and I will do my best to answer them for you.
summary: Perfect Length, Beautiful Pendant Display, Great Gift Idea For Any Taylor Swift Fan!

reviewText:
I purchased this piece as a birthday gift for a relative. Her birthday is not for a few weeks, but I am going to be happy to present it to her.
It is a lovely piece of jewelry. The Swarovski pendant is brilliant, and the sterling neck chain delicate.
The best part is I purchased this item as a daily deal and the price couldn't have been better. I am pleased with the piece, and I am sure the recepient will be very happy to receive it.

I purchased this bead at a steep discount and was asked to share my honest thoughts.  This is a gorgeous bead, the cut is very nicely done so the pendant glints/refracts the light at all different angles.  As a necklace this makes for a rather simple piece.  I plan to use it on bracelets - I collect charm beads and the core on this is wide enough to fit over both Pandora and Trollbead style metal bracelets.  The pendant/bead itself is perfectly sized to fit in with charm beads - it's the same height as most Pandora glass, and is slightly wider giving it a fun/fresh chunky look.

The core on this piece is sterling silver which is what most mid range jewelry items are made out of.  It will eventually benefit from a bit of buffing with a silver cloth, but it has a great shine to it.  The necklace came in a sturdy little jewelry box.  The chain itself was knotted up (I believe someone else had this issue too?) but it only took me a minute or two to get it sorted out - I've suggested to the seller that they package the chain separately to prevent this issue in the future.  Aside from that small issue, I love everything about this piece.  The price is in line with what I pay for similar styles from other brands, so I consider it reasonable.  Two thumbs up for a versatile and lovely little piece.  :)

reviewText:
This mens tri-fold wallet from Secret Felicity is beautifully made, well designed and the leather feels so good in your hand. Plus, it's noticeably larger than many wallets while still fitting easily into a pants or jacket pocket.

First of all, it's called a tri-fold style but it's different than most tri-fold wallets I've seen. Instead of the wallet folding into thirds, it folds in half like a bi-fold wallet. However, inside are two flaps that are held in place with a leather, snap tab. The flaps have 3 window slots for photo IDs and 4 credit card slots.

Additionally, there are 4 more credit card slots inside, a coin pocket with a snap closure, an additional open pocket, a zippered compartment and a divided folding money pocket, which allows you to keep checks and folding money separate.

The interior of the wallet is lined.

The leather is absolutely gorgeous. It's a deep chestnut brown with a waxy finish. This is uncorrected leather, which means you will see the occasional scar, blemish and stretch mark the cow sustained in it's life. I really like uncorrected leather because I think it's more durable and I like the unique markings. It also feels "broken in" the minute it arrives. My son loves this because it's not stiff in his pocket. It's the kind of leather that will burnish over time and develop a beautiful, smooth patina.

There is topstitching inside and out that is perfectly executed and very attractive.

The "spine" of the wallet has an unusual design that allows you to open the folding money area much wider than in most wallets and it makes it easier to slip your money and/or checks in your wallet.

If you're looking for a generously sized wallet made of real, natural leather, this is a good one to consider.

NOTE: I was given a free sample for review but a positive review was not asked for, promised or implied. (Recent changes on Amazon have made it impossible to turn off the Verified Purchase badge as I used to in the past, unfortunately.)

I love the look and feel of the leather on this wallet. It is well made with even stitching. The wallet opens up and has plenty of room for cards. I like that there is a snap strap that goes across the credit card area to keep it more secure. There is also a snap area for change as well as a zippered area inside to keep money or other valuables a little more secure. The brown color looks nice. The leather is soft and high quality. The bill fold area has a nice quality lining. The wallet is definitely made to last.

While the wallet does fit in a back pocket, it is a little big and bulkier than some. However, it does make it harder to pull out of the pocket which is good if somebody is trying to take it.

Disclosure: I received the wallet in exchange for an honest review.

I bought this wallet for me as a lady, rather then my husband.  I found it looking for a wallet for my dad.  I love that this wallet has the fun coin button pouch inside and also has larger picture photo slots, which you can also use for an ID and plenty of card spaces and is fine for dollar bills as well.  It smell great and seems well made.  I have had no trouble with fitting dollar bills or a few checks on hand in the money slots given for it.  The only thing I would say is that the leather does scratch easily, but what can you expect from leather. Also, it is larger then most men would likely want to use, since like my husband they carry their wallet in their back pocket. My husband said it would be too large for him.  I love it though and don't think it is too bad size wise, works great in a purse.  Also, the front slot could be used for a pull out ID, but seems better for a small picture instead, due to the button strap on the side to protect credit cards from falling out. I love the old fashioned type design of this wallet and want another one. It saves me carrying a coin purse and is great for credit cards etc..
summary: A fun wallet for a Lady, larger wallet, coin purse inside,good for credit cards, picture spaces, fun old fashioned design

Lots of room in a sturdy, well-crafted wallet for a great price. Well worth it if you are thinking of snapping this up.
